intro: Metrosideros collina var. haleakalesis, commonly known as the Haleakalā silversword, is a rare endemic species native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and striking red flowers. The plant thrives in the high-elevation volcanic soils of Haleakalā National Park, where it is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered critically endangered. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect and propagate this unique botanical species.
